intro: Cistanthe laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
